perturbation.original_text:
1. Definitions
1.1 The "Equipment Rental Business" or "ERB" has the meaning given to such term in the Distribution Agreement.
1.2 "Interim Period" means a period of four (4) years commencing from the Effective Date of this Agreement.
1.3 "Other Intellectual Property" means any copyrights, trade dress, content, designs or other indicia and/or social media accounts and handles owned by THC and/or HSI that are already used or otherwise in the possession of HERC relating to the HERTZ and HERTZ-formative trademarks and logos in connection with the Equipment Rental Business.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. Definitions
1.1 The "Equipment Rental Business" or "ERB" has the meaning given to such term in the Distribution Agreement.
1.2 "Interim Period" means a period of two (2) years commencing from the Effective Date of this Agreement.
1.3 "Other Intellectual Property" means any copyrights, trade dress, content, designs or other indicia and/or social media accounts and handles owned by THC and/or HSI that are already used or otherwise in the possession of HERC relating to the HERTZ and HERTZ-formative trademarks and logos in connection with the Equipment Rental Business.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Interim Period' is changed from four years to two years. This introduces a contradiction because various sections of the contract rely on the 'Interim Period' being four years long, particularly sections concerning the duration of licenses and permitted use of trademarks. This affects the interpretation of timelines related to intellectual property rights, creating uncertainty in enforcement. Specifically, section 2.2.1 states that HERC shall discontinue use of certain trademarks upon expiration of the Interim Period, so the question is what the real period, which is now contradicted.
perturbation.contradicted_text:
2.2 In the case of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks:
2.2.1 HSI will retain ownership and will grant a royalty-free, non-exclusive license to HERC to use the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks (those foreign trademarks owned by HSI related to the ERB that incorporate the mark/name HERTZ) as set forth on Schedule A, for the Interim Period, outside the United States and Puerto Rico, as more fully set forth in the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement attached as Exhibit A. HERC shall immediately discontinue use of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks upon expiration of the Interim Period, or the earlier termination of this Agreement or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1 Notice of Infringement. HERC shall promptly notify HSI of the use of any mark by any third party which HERC considers might be an infringement or passing off of any HERTZ or HERTZ-formative intellectual property used by or licensed to HERC pursuant 6 to the terms hereof or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement. However, HSI shall have the sole right to decide whether or not proceedings shall be brought against such third parties. In the event that HSI decides that action should be taken against such third parties, HSI may take such action either in its own name or, alternatively, HSI may authorize HERC to initiate such action in HERC's name. In any event, the Parties agree to cooperate fully with each other to the extent necessary to prosecute such action, all expenses being borne by the Party bringing such action and all damages which may be recovered being solely for the account of that Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 Notice of Infringement. HERC may notify HSI of the use of any mark by any third party which HERC considers might be an infringement or passing off of any HERTZ or HERTZ-formative intellectual property used by or licensed to HERC pursuant 6 to the terms hereof or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement. HERC shall have the sole right to decide whether or not proceedings shall be brought against such third parties. In the event that HERC decides that action should be taken against such third parties, HERC may take such action either in its own name or, alternatively, HSI may authorize HERC to initiate such action in HERC's name. In any event, the Parties agree to cooperate fully with each other to the extent necessary to prosecute such action, all expenses being borne by the Party bringing such action and all damages which may be recovered being solely for the account of that Party.
perturbation.explanation: The clause 'HERC shall promptly notify HSI' is changed to 'HERC may notify HSI' and 'HSI shall have the sole right to decide whether or not proceedings shall be brought against such third parties' is changed to 'HERC shall have the sole right to decide whether or not proceedings shall be brought against such third parties.'. This changes the responsibility and right of initiating action for trademark infringement from HSI to HERC, contradicting the later clause which states, 'HSI may authorize HERC to initiate such action in HERC's name.' making it unclear who has the ultimate authority and decision to initiate the infringements.
perturbation.contradicted_text: 5.1 Notice of Infringement. HERC may notify HSI of the use of any mark by any third party which HERC considers might be an infringement or passing off of any HERTZ or HERTZ-formative intellectual property used by or licensed to HERC pursuant 6 to the terms hereof or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement. HERC shall have the sole right to decide whether or not proceedings shall be brought against such third parties. In the event that HERC decides that action should be taken against such third parties, HERC may take such action either in its own name or, alternatively, HSI may authorize HERC to initiate such action in HERC's name. In any event, the Parties agree to cooperate fully with each other to the extent necessary to prosecute such action, all expenses being borne by the Party bringing such action and all damages which may be recovered being solely for the account of that Party.

perturbation.original_text:
2.5 In the case of the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks owned by HERC:
2.5.1 HERC will have the right to retain ownership and use of the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks (those US trademarks owned by HERC related to the ERB that incorporate the mark/name HERTZ) as set forth on Schedule D for the Interim Period. HERC shall immediately discontinue use of the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks and abandon or voluntarily withdraw or cancel any applications or registrations therefor upon expiration of the Interim Period as more fully set forth in the Coexistence Agreement attached hereto as Exhibit C and/or the earlier termination of this Agreement or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement. The Parties shall cooperate to ensure that no confusion arises in the marketplace during the Interim Period, as more fully set forth in the Coexistence Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.5 In the case of the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks owned by HERC:
2.5.1 HERC will have the right to retain ownership and use of the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks (those US trademarks owned by HERC related to the ERB that incorporate the mark/name HERTZ) indefinitely. HERC shall immediately discontinue use of the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks and abandon or voluntarily withdraw or cancel any applications or registrations therefor upon expiration of the Interim Period as more fully set forth in the Coexistence Agreement attached hereto as Exhibit C and/or the earlier termination of this Agreement or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement. The Parties shall cooperate to ensure that no confusion arises in the marketplace during the Interim Period, as more fully set forth in the Coexistence Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The clause 'as set forth on Schedule D for the Interim Period' is changed to 'indefinitely'. This creates a direct contradiction with the subsequent sentence stating 'HERC shall immediately discontinue use of the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks and abandon or voluntarily withdraw or cancel any applications or registrations therefor upon expiration of the Interim Period'. The amended version states HERC can use the trademarks indefinitely while also requiring them to discontinue use after the Interim Period, thus creating ambiguity around the term of usage
perturbation.contradicted_text: 2.5.1 HERC will have the right to retain ownership and use of the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks (those US trademarks owned by HERC related to the ERB that incorporate the mark/name HERTZ) indefinitely. HERC shall immediately discontinue use of the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks and abandon or voluntarily withdraw or cancel any applications or registrations therefor upon expiration of the Interim Period as more fully set forth in the Coexistence Agreement attached hereto as Exhibit C and/or the earlier termination of this Agreement or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement. The Parties shall cooperate to ensure that no confusion arises in the marketplace during the Interim Period, as more fully set forth in the Coexistence Agreement.
